forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Chance Light Rain then Slight Chance Rain Showers
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 10pm, then a slight chance of rain showers. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 52. Southwest wind 2 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers likely. Partly sunny. High near 60, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 2 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As twilight settles over Downtown San Francisco, a gentle chill wraps the city, hinting at the moisture that lingers in the air. There's a palpable sense of transition as rain comes into play—expect a few light showers before night fully embraces us, possibly delaying your evening stroll along the Embarcadero. With temperatures dipping to a cool 52 degrees, ensure you have a light jacket to fend off both the wind and the occasional drizzle. The skies remain mostly cloudy, cloaking our iconic landscapes in a soft, gray veil that speaks of the imminent rain.

Thursday beckons with a greater promise of rain, marked by a likelihood of showers intertwined with moments of fleeting sunshine. The day will see temperatures peaking at a cool 60 before gently falling into the afternoon. While the wind, though only modestly brisk, adds a touch of bite, it's an excellent excuse to seek solace indoors—perhaps curling up with a good book at your favorite café, or exploring the myriad of small art galleries sprinkled throughout the neighborhoods. Those adventurous spirits might enjoy an early sunset, casting golden hues over the fog-cloaked hills, inviting a cozy evening in this ever-enigmatic city.
